title: Ticket #1092: Git update hook to disallow development code in stable branches
description:
On two recent occasions (#1089, #1091), a significant amount of development code on the master branch was merged into V7_4-branch. This is bad for several reasons. To help prevent this from happening in the future, we should add an update hook in our main git repository that rejects pushes that introduce commits from the master branch into any stable branch. Cherry-picking of individual commits should still be allowed.

The update hook can work as follows. If a branch head is being moved (not created or deleted) and the branch name indicates it's a stable branch (i.e. '=Vx_y...=' where x and y are numbers and y is even), then perform the following check: Produce a list of SHA1s that are on master but not on the stable branch, and a list of SHA1s that the push is adding to the stable branch. If these two lists contain any common elements, reject the push.

Cherry-picking commits from master to a stable branch would be allowed, since the new commits have new SHA1s. Branch creation is always allowed, so creating a new stable series branch off of master would work fine.
remarks:
2010-Jan-07 10:30:25 by jfrey:
I've attached the proposed update hook script. I will replace most of the echos with comments before putting it in place.

2010-Jan-07 12:43:25 by danb:
I don't spot any problems, but you could consider replacing this: 

        git rev-list $oldrev..refs/heads/master >$tmpfile
        git rev-list $oldrev..$newrev >>$tmpfile
        if sort $tmpfile | uniq -c | grep -q -v '^ *1 ' ; then
            badness=1
        fi
        rm -rf $tmpfile

with the following: 

        git rev-list $oldrev..refs/heads/master > $tmpfile.master
        git rev-list $oldrev..$newrev > $tmpfile.stable
        if grep -q -F -f $tmpfile.master $tmpfile.stable ; then
            badness=1
        fi
        rm -rf $tmpfile.master $tmpfile.stable

2010-Jan-07 16:18:49 by jfrey:
I learned new a grep option today. Neat. I'll use your suggested replacement.

2010-Jan-07 16:19:19 by jfrey:
The update hook is now live in the central git repository.
